title: 112_s170
content: The Act titled "Helping Responsible Homeowners Act" allows for affordable refinancing of mortgages owned or guaranteed by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac. The Act defines key terms such as Director, Enterprise, Qualified mortgage, and Refinancing mortgage. The Act defines key terms such as Director, Enterprise, Qualified mortgage, and Refinancing mortgage. A refinancing mortgage is a mortgage used to pay off an existing qualified mortgage on the same property, with a fair interest rate not exceeding 40 basis points above the required net yield for a prime conventional conforming fixed rate mortgage. The Federal National Mortgage Association and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation are authorized to refinance qualified mortgages on single-family housing with no loan-to-value ratio limit, waived prepayment penalties, and a maximum 40-year term to maturity. The Federal National Mortgage Association and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation are authorized to refinance qualified mortgages on single-family housing without additional fees beyond the standard guarantee fee. Servicers or creditors holding second liens on qualified mortgages must allow resubordination for refinancing eligibility. The Director may extend the program established under this section in 1-year increments, and regulations or guidance necessary for the program shall be issued. The Federal National Mortgage Association and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation must ensure that mortgage servicers inform borrowers about the refinancing program. The Director will include updates on the program in the monthly Foreclosure Prevention & Refinance Report.
